availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Buchanan County, Missouri, politician and attorney. Cortland County, New York, native. Son of Charles Stewart and Elizabeth Severance Stewart. Admitted to the bar in 1837, Member of the Senate of the State of Missouri from Buchanan County from 1846 to 1857. Attorney in Buchanan County, Missouri, in 1850. Governor of the State of Missouri from 1857 to 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Missouri, Buchanan County, Washington, p. 14B.
“Robert Marcellus Stewart, 1857-1860,” Missouri Digital Heritage, accessed January 21, 2024, https://www.sos.mo.gov/archives/mdhsplash/default?coll=rmstewart.
Rossiter Johnson, ed. "Stewart, Robert Marcellus," in _The Twentieth Century Biographical Dictionary of Notable Americans, (Boston: Photographical Society, 1904), vol. 10.
